Content: @lollipop search the address in  explorer: kmdexplorer.io

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: if you selected "custom seed" then there is a possibility that you have input a wrong seed

Author: lollipop#1682

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
no need to uninstall
just select "restore" in the welcome screen and give it a different name

Author: lollipop#1682

Content: you can also delete the wrong wallet from "settings"

Content: if you don't select "custom seed", the wallet will only allow you to proceed if you enter a seed that was created by atomicDEX

agama?

then you should select "custom seed" and enter the words properly. click the eye icon to see the words you are entering
and don't add extra spaces

Author: IamTrader#6042
Content: is eth in atomicdex a smart contract or direct transfer?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@IamTrader it uses a smart contract
what do you mean by direct transfer?

Author: IamTrader#6042
Content: @gcharang ah okay, coz the exchange i use it says it does not support smart contract just direct transfer

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@IamTrader the receiving address for ETH in atomicDEX is a normal address
so it is a direct transfer
what I said previously is that, for atomic swap involving ETH, we use smart contracts
so you should be able to withdraw to your atomicDEX ETH address

Author: benzo365#8202
Content: Really, minimum BTC buy is .00777? Is this a bug?

Author: dudezmobi#1945
Content: Looks like it

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @benzo365 Hi! It's not a bug - minimal swap amount is 0.00777 determined by protocol and the same for all coins. I'm agree that it's quite high amount in USD equialent. But from another side it's better to trade huge amounts of BTC because of tx fees.

Author: Privatoshi#7913
Content: $80 btc minimum for buys

Author: phideas#8309
Content: no one should complain, btc is digital gold after all. heavy and expensive. by design.

Author: Privatoshi#7913
Content: well since you said no one should complain, then u must be right, naturally.

Author: phideas#8309
Content: üôÇ i don't have to be right, btc is as it is on layer one. not realy suitable for small tx.

Author: Privatoshi#7913
Content: Which set of layers we referring to?

Author: Privatoshi#7913
Content: How about the LN?

Author: phideas#8309
Content: Yes, LN is designed to do micro tx with BTC. But it is different tech, L2 solution. Not suited for komodo atomic swaps afaik,

Author: benzo365#8202
Content: In my opinion a DEX shouldn't have restrictions like this

Author: phideas#8309
Content: i agree $80 is a bit overkill for a min. amount per swap. btc is currently capable to do it cheaper, but otoh btc fees can change rapidly as "number go up" üôÇ

Author: wl#4107
Content: I had some rewards to claim, but after sending some kmd to another wallet I have no more rewards to claim, is that how it's supposed to behave or is a bug? If I'm correct, on the agama wallet this was possible (send some and still have my previously accumulated kmd to claim)...

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: when you send it claims it for you

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @wl that is a feature - when sending a TX the reward is automagically claimed. You can actually check your transaction on the blockexplorer and will see the reward.

Author: wl#4107
Content: Thanks for the quick answer, I know it's like that on the agama I didn't know the AtomicDex had it too

Author: ca333#0118
Content: Thanks for the feedback - i will take it as a feature request (improvement) - we will add a logic that checks potential rewards before sending a transaction and informs the user about the automagic claiming and corresponding amount...
